revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Belkin |model=F7D8301 |revision=v1 |upc=722868813126 |asin=B0047T7AIU |fcc_date=03/16/2010 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WG8117F22 |manuf_rev=2-LF-AK |type=wireless router |fcc_id=K7SF7D4301V1 |ic_id=3623A-F7D4301V1 |pcb_id=141811720000J |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4718A1 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN29LV640B-90TIP |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM68B16CWPA-25H |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag=yes,, 14-pin header,, J2,, |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200,8,N,1),, J3,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4718A1 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=soldered |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43224 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL (internal) |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=4.9 to 5.9GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5530;;2; ,,, 30V Dual N-Channel MOSFET;Matsuki Electric;ME4970;;1; ,,, Low drop positive voltage regulator;STMicroelectronics;LD1117;;1; ,,, Single Synchronous Step Down Controller;Texas Instruments;TPS51117;;1; |stock_boot=CFE;1.0.8e |stock_os=Linux;2.6.22; |tp_firmware=DD-WRT, Tomato (Shibby) |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=belkin.XXXX,belkin.XXXX.5ghz |default_ssid_regex=^belkin.[a-f0-9]{4}$,,,^belkin.[a-f0-9]{4}.5ghz$ |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |oui=94:44:52 |oui_eth=94:44:52 }} {{TagLine|Play N600 HD WIreless Dual-band N Router}}
"P/N: 141811720000J REV: 01" is silkscreened on the board.
*[http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-570847 On the '''TomatoUSB''' forums] :It is reported that the device is working with the latest Toastman builds. :.. and it would seem to be supported by [http://tomato.groov.pl/tomatoanon.php?model=Belkin%20Play%20Max%20/%20N600%20HD%20(F7D4301/F7D8301)%20v1 ''Shibby'''s Tomato builds]
The default SSID patterns for this device appear to be '''belkin.XXXX''' :and '''belkin.XXXX.5ghz''', where '''XXXX''' is the last two octets :of the LAN interface MAC (lower case hex letters).
